t: Prayer with Confidence in Final Salvation
Hear*pn a just cause, O Lord,*s Attend*ld to my cry; Give*ld ear to my prayer which*i is*i not from deceitful lips.
Let*ld my vindication come from Your presence; Let*ld Your eyes look on the things that are upright.
You*ln have tested my heart; You*ld have visited me*i in the night; You*ld have tried me and have found nothing; I*ld have purposed that my mouth shall not transgress.
Concerning*ld the works of men, By*ld the word of Your lips, I*ld have kept away from the paths of the destroyer.
Uphold*ld my steps in Your paths, That*ild my footsteps may not slip.
I*ln have called upon You, for You will hear me, O God; Incline*ld Your ear to me, and*i hear my speech.
Show*ld Your marvelous lovingkindness by Your right hand, O*ld You who save those who trust in*i You*i From*ld those who rise up against*i them.*i
Keep*ld me as the apple of Your eye; Hide*ld me under the shadow of Your wings,
From*ld the wicked who oppress me, From*ild my deadly enemies who surround me.
They*ln have closed up their fat hearts;*i With*ld their mouths they speak proudly.
They*ld have now surrounded us in our steps; They*ld have set their eyes, crouching down to the earth,
As*ld a lion is eager to tear his prey, And*ld like a young lion lurking in secret places.
Arise,*ln O Lord,*s Confront*ld him, cast him down; Deliver*ld my life from the wicked with Your sword,

With*ld Your hand from men, O Lord,*s From*ld men of the world who*i have*i their portion in this*i life, And*ld whose belly You fill with Your hidden treasure. They*ld are satisfied with children, And*ld leave the rest of their possession*i for their babes.
As*ln for me, I will see Your face in righteousness; I*ld shall be satisfied when I awake in Your likeness.
